abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is satisfactory, and
            sustainability is rated highly likely. Both World Bank and
            Borrower performances are rated satisfactory. Lessons were
            several: Political commitment to the project was translated
            into specific and tangible indicators, such as increased
            education budgets, supportive policies and regulations, and
            public-private-nongovernmental organization alliances.
            Parents, students, teachers, and administrations need to
            understand how the evaluation of student learning
            achievement, of teacher performance, and of financial and
            human resource management contribute to ensuring a more
            effective and efficient delivery of education services.
            Community-management improves effectiveness in the delivery
            of education services. Monitoring and evaluation systems
            should be able to gauge the impact of inputs in education
            outcomes. Appropriate planning, and management and
            information systems are strategic for successful project
            implementation. Pilot initiatives are an important tool for
            continuous exploration of innovative and alternative
            approaches to the delivery of education services. This
            project exemplifies the benefits of integrating education,
            health, and nutrition services at the local level. The
            inter-institutional coordination prompted by such strategies
            is instrumental in maximizing resource use, expanding access
            to services, and lowering delivery costs. Inter-ministerial
            negotiations allowed for efficient and transparent
            decentralized financial procedures.

repnme.cdata!: El Salvador - Basic Education Modernization Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Basic Education Modernization
            Project will promote greater equity, quality and efficiency
            in the provision of education services by improving access
            to education; improving educaion quality in both academic
            achievement (output) and learning environment (education
            inputs); and strengthening the managerial, financial and
            administrative capacity of the Ministry of Education (MINED)
            to set policies and guidelines for the sector and deliver
            public education services efficiently. The project has been
            organized into three major components: 1) expansion of
            access to preschool and basic education; 2) improvement in
            education quality; and 3) institutional modernization and strengthening.
